metadata.Title: CVE-2018-5813 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
An error within the "parse_minolta()" function (dcraw/dcraw.c) in LibRawversions prior to 0.18.11 can be exploited to trigger an infinite loop viaa specially crafted file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5813` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libraw-bin - 0.15.4-1ubuntu0.3
libraw9 - 0.15.4-1ubuntu0.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libraw package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.15.4-1ubuntu0.3').
ufraw: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
darktable: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
